page.title: 08THE SPAR SHOP,BRIGHSTONE
page.content: The Spar shop is a focal point of the village. As well as selling important supplies (mainly food) for locals and tourists alike, it also provides a place to gather and natter! The busiest times for the lady who runs the shop are Christmas and the summer.Throughout the year she opens from Monday to Saturday from 7.30am to 6.00pm with an hour closed for lunch. She has five helpers, some of whom are part_time. Many of her customers use the shop as an unofficial bank as there is none in Brighstone and the Post Office is often busy. The shop is situated in a central position in the village right opposite the tea gardens which means that the coach loads of visitors often shop here.When asked if it seemed quiet in winter the owner replied that that was when the locals came out!
